channel.title: Fuck You(Tube)
channel.description:
YouTube just plain sucks.
You know it's not a hip trend anymore when old people on the television start throwing in random references to it just to show they're in on the latest hip trends.
Why is everyone falling over themselves to lick YouTubes nuts? I checked out Yahoo Video the other day, and about half the clips on Yahoo Video were videos about clips on YouTube. What the fuck is wrong with the people at Yahoo, didn't anybody ever tell them the way to get ahead on the internet is to [b]steal[/b] your competitors content, not link to it?
Google Video provides free, giant, blurry video, which I much prefer to YouTube. Also, I own a lot of google stock, so if I didn't say I preferred their service, they would probably come to my house and kill me. But they would kill me super efficiently. With robots. Robots that also cleaned my house, walked my dogs, and then raped my girlfriend. Because that's how they do things at google: Clean. Googley.
YouTube is a piece of shit website. They censor videos they don't like, require an annoying registration to look at the few good videos they do have, and they just generally suck the proverbial monkey nut in the sky. Please tell me Jesus didn't die for these assholes, so they can browse YouTube and tell me how new and exciting it is, over, and over, and fucking over again.
YouTube has seen massive success (or at least, massive buzz, because the only way it would be a success is if it managed to pull all the US troops out of Iraq, invade Poland, and grow a new strain of hybrid marijuana) in large part due to the number of people who own a computer, and have access to the internet, and are mentally retarded. These idiot savantes, as they are so often incorrectly labelled, use the internet constantly, and yet only manage to do a few things with it. They chat on IM, or do a few google searches, or look at urban dictionary, and they think they're the cats pajamas. Well, fuck them. Back in the day we interneted with style. We found the funny movies ourselves. We could make our own fun.
Any website that can convince people they are on the cutting edge can easily sell itself to the masses. However, the apex of funny videos on the internet, in terms of the actual amount of laughter per minute that could be attained on average, has already come and gone. Youtube is actually ancient history, and the [b]real[/b] web hipsters have moved on to bigger and better things.

@The_Un-Named wrote:

Google Videos is the best. :)[/quote]

did you know that youtube use 45 terabyte of bandwidth a month!!! and it costs them something like 7 million a month to maintain it, and that they reckon that people have allready watched over 4000 years of video from it, this is just crazy!

in my opinion youtube is awesome

facts from www.torrentfreak.com

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck You(Tube)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

NEW YORK (Reuters) - Billionaire investor and dot-com veteran Mark Cuban had harsh words on Thursday for YouTube, the online site that lets people share video clips, saying only a "moron" would purchase the wildly popular start-up.
DE

Wirtschafts & Finanz-Nachrichten, aktuelle US & Internationale...

Reuters.de versorgt Sie mit Nachrichten aus aller Welt und berichtet über die neuesten Entwicklungen in Wirtschaft, Politik und Technologie, auch in den Formaten Video und Foto. (we don't do Entertainment; that would be Unterhaltung)

Last week, the New York Post put a $1.5 billion rumored for sale price tag on YouTube, up 50% from its $1 billion “name your YouTube sales price” target from a few months earlier.
ZDNet

Blogs | ZDNet

ZDNet's technology experts deliver the best tech news and analysis on the latest issues and events in IT for business technology professionals, IT managers and tech-savvy business people.

When Fox News’ ever-popular interview with former President Bill Clinton hit YouTube, the Wall Street Journal’s Law Blog wondered what was up: “Did you see Chris Wallace’s interview with Bill Clinton? If not, you can watch it here, thanks to YouTube. But wait a minute, doesn’t Fox News own a copyright on this content? Is the video-sharing site breaking the law?”

Actually, that’s pretty much what Fox News thought when they contacted YouTube and requested that the clips be removed from the site. Ever the dispenser of new media wisdom, BuzzMachiner Jeff Jarvis concluded that was an idiot move: “Fools. They would be getting a whole new audience. They’d be even more part of the conversation.”

Well, apparently Fox News agreed with that too, because the following day, the clips reappeared on YouTube. Fox News told digital news site dmwmedia (via TVNewser) that the move was a mistake.

“In an official statement, Fox News claims that their Internet division used ‘poor judgment’ when going after YouTubers. Strategically, Fox News recognizes that the clips are of great PR value and that the company is ‘thrilled’ that the interview received so much publicity.</blockquote>
cbsnews.com

The Trouble With YouTube

Fox News Gets Into The Weeds With YouTube

YouTube

Office of National Drug Control Policy

The official channel of the Office of National Drug Control Policy


Read full topic

item.title: Fuck You(Tube)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

[quote]Youtube enables people who don’t have access to large amounts of bandwidth to show their videos to the world for free.
Where’s the bad side?/quote]

As I’ve said, it’s over promoted, especially by people who have no idea what they’re talking about. Traditional sources for finding videos on the internet (filesharing apps, forums, news groups, random websites) yield funnier and fresher content. It’s not cool to fight popular things, but we have to fight the man, and the man wants us to use YouTube.

Read full topic

item.title: Fuck You(Tube)
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

hey when computers came out didn't you have to access things through the command propmt?Like "Internetexploarisgaqymozzilarock thingo"My mum would know but seeing Paul you are a community member you know^.^

I wasn’t alive when computers came out, and I hope to god your mother wasn’t either.

As to the lonelygirl15 stupidity, I am happy to say I have never heard of it untill you told me about it and I did some research (so I don’t think it’s the major reason, there is no reason, YouTube is shit). It seems like just the kind of bullshit that YouTube promotes. Thanks for helping me out here, the more evidence of YouTubes lack of tangible quality content we can gather the better.
